steps.title: I AM WITHOUT KNOWLEDGE NOW.
steps.instructions: There must be a starting point at any juncture of development. You must start from where you are, not from where you want to be. You start here in the understanding that you are without Knowledge. That is not to say that Knowledge is not with you. It is simply to say that you are not with Knowledge. Knowledge is waiting for you to proceed. Knowledge is waiting to give itself to you. Therefore, you are beginning now to prepare to be in relationship with Knowledge, the greater aspect of mind that you have brought with you from your Ancient Home. Three times today spend 10 minutes thinking about what Knowledge is, not merely applying your own ideas, not merely applying your past understanding, but thinking about what Knowledge really is.

steps.title: KNOWLEDGE IS WITH ME. WHERE AM I?
steps.instructions: Knowledge is with you, completely, but it resides in a part of your mind to which you have not yet gained access. Knowledge represents your True Self, your True Mind and your true relationships in the universe. It also possesses your greater calling in the world and a perfect utilization of your nature, all of your inherent abilities and skills, even your limitations - all to be given for good in the world. Knowledge is with you, but where are you? Today think about where you are. If you are not with Knowledge, where are you? Therefore, three times today, 10 minutes each, think about where you are, not just physically or geographically, but where you are in terms of your awareness of yourself in the world. Think very, very carefully. Do not allow your mind to distract you from this orientation. It is essential now at the beginning of your preparation to ask these questions very seriously.

steps.title: I AM IN THE WORLD AND I AM FROM KNOWLEDGE.
steps.instructions: You are in the world and you are from Knowledge. This is a statement of truth. It is not an evaluation of your present state. It is a statement of truth regarding your nature and your presence in the world. You are in the world and you are from Knowledge. Therefore, three times today, 10 minutes each, think about this statement. Think about what it might mean. Think about how it might be true. Think about how it is true for you.

steps.title: I WANT WHAT I THINK I KNOW.
steps.instructions: This statement represents the great folly of humanity and humanity's predicament. You want what you think you know, and this is what drives you to folly, to error and to great aggravation. This is what drives you into confusion and into the commission of acts which do not represent Knowledge. You want what you think you know, and yet what you are coming to learn is Knowledge itself, which will replace what you think you know with a greater truth, a greater experience and a greater relationship. In your two practice periods today, 10 minutes each, think about this idea. Think about what it means in your life. Think about how it is true for you. Think about how it has influenced your decisions and your behavior.

steps.title: I BELIEVE WHAT I WANT TO BELIEVE.
steps.instructions: This statement represents the great folly of humanity and humanity's predicament. You believe what you want to believe, and this is what drives you to folly, to error and to great aggravation. This is what drives you into confusion and into the commission of acts which do not represent Knowledge. You believe what you want to believe, and yet what you are coming to learn is Knowledge itself, which will replace what you believe with a greater truth, a greater experience and a greater relationship. In your two practice periods today, 10 minutes each, think about this idea. Think about what it means in your life. Think about how it is true for you. Think about how it has influenced your decisions and your behavior.

steps.title: I HAVE A TRUE FOUNDATION IN THE WORLD.
steps.instructions: Beyond what you think you know and beyond what you believe, there is a greater foundation in the world. This foundation is your purpose for being here, which is yet to be discovered. This foundation is your relationship with Knowledge, which is yet to be reclaimed. This foundation is your destiny in the world, which is yet to be fulfilled. In your two practice periods today, 10 minutes each, think about this idea. Think about what it means in your life. Think about how it is true for you. Think about how it has influenced your decisions and your behavior.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: In today's two practice periods, review all that We have covered thus far, beginning with the first step and continuing on up to include the preceding day's step. Then consider the entire sequence of the steps together. It is very important at this juncture that you not require that you have any conclusions, but that you ask questions and realize the extent to which you need true Knowledge. If you undertake this practice today sincerely, it will be most evident that you have this great need. You are vulnerable without your assumptions, but you are also in a position to receive truth and certainty in life.

steps.title: TODAY I WILL BE STILL.
steps.instructions: In your two practice periods today, practice stillness. This is a practice in not doing, in not acting, in not thinking, in not moving. This is a practice in being present with yourself and with Knowledge. In your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, sit quietly, close your eyes and simply be present. Do not think about the past. Do not think about the future. Do not think about your problems. Simply be still.

steps.title: IN STILLNESS ALL THINGS CAN BE KNOWN.
steps.instructions: In stillness all things can be known, for in stillness the mind is not agitated, the body is not restless and the emotions are not turbulent. In stillness you can experience the presence of Knowledge, which is the presence of truth within you. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice stillness. Sit quietly, close your eyes and simply be present. Do not think about the past. Do not think about the future. Do not think about your problems. Simply be still.

steps.title: What is Knowledge?
steps.instructions: Let us say that Knowledge is not the things that are usually associated with it. It is not ideas. It is not a body of information. It is not a system of belief. It is not a process of self-evaluation. It is the great mystery of your life. Its outward manifestations are profound intuition, great insight, inexplicable knowing, wise perception in the present and in the future and wise understanding of the past. But despite these great achievements of mind, Knowledge is greater than this. It is your True Self, a Self that is not apart from life. Read the lesson three times today.
practices: Read the lesson three times today 1
Read the lesson three times today 2
Read the lesson three times today 3

steps.title: I AM NOT APART FROM LIFE.
steps.instructions: You are not apart from life, though you may think so. You are not apart from life, though you may feel so. You are not apart from life, though you may live so. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, think about this idea. Think about what it means in your life. Think about how it is true for you. Think about how it has influenced your decisions and your behavior.

steps.title: MY INDIVIDUALITY IS TO SERVE A GREATER PURPOSE.
steps.instructions: Your individuality is to serve a greater purpose, a purpose that you have not created but which you are designed to fulfill. This purpose is your contribution to the world, a contribution that can only be made through Knowledge. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, think about this idea. Think about what it means in your life. Think about how it is true for you. Think about how it has influenced your decisions and your behavior.

steps.title: I WANT TO BE SEPARATE TO BE UNIQUE.
steps.instructions: This thought represents the true motive for separation, yet it is unnecessary. We do not give it here as an affirmation but as an expression of your current state. You want to be separate because this defines your self; your self is defined in terms of separation, not in terms of inclusion. Separation is the source of all your pain and confusion of mind. Your physical life demonstrates a separate life but only from a certain point of view. Given another point of view, it does not demonstrate separation at all. It demonstrates a unique expression of a Greater Reality. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, look at this idea of separation and recognize the pain and the frustration that it has brought to you.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: Today in your two long practice periods, review the first thirteen lessons. Read each one slowly and carefully, and recall your practice and your experiences with each one. Allow each one to penetrate your mind. See their application in your life. See their relationship to one another. See how they are beginning to reveal a greater truth to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your own nature to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your purpose in the world. In your review, read each lesson and recall what you thought when you first read it and what you felt when you first practiced it. Then review your practice for that day and see what your experience was. See what your experience is today as you look upon it. This review will take time, but it will be a great confirmation for you and it will give strength to your ability to learn and to prepare.

steps.title: I SHALL LISTEN TO MY EXPERIENCE TODAY.
steps.instructions: Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, listen to your experience. Do not think about it. Do not analyze it. Do not evaluate it. Simply listen to it. Feel what it is telling you. Feel what it is showing you. Feel what it is revealing to you. This is a practice in listening, in being present, in being open to what is within you and around you.

steps.title: I WILL LISTEN TO MY INNER VOICE TODAY.
steps.instructions: Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, listen to your inner voice. This is the voice of Knowledge within you, the voice that speaks of truth, of certainty, of direction. It is not the voice of fear, of doubt, of confusion. It is a deeper voice, a quieter voice, a voice that you must be still to hear. Sit quietly, close your eyes and listen. Do not think about the past. Do not think about the future. Simply listen.

steps.title: TODAY I WANT TO HEAR THE TRUTH.
steps.instructions: The truth is not always what you want to hear, but it is what you need to hear. The truth is not always comfortable, but it is always liberating. Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, practice listening for the truth. Listen to your inner voice. Listen to your experience. Listen to the world around you. Be open to what is true, even if it challenges your beliefs, your assumptions, your desires.

steps.title: TODAY I WILL NOT PRETEND I AM HAPPY.
steps.instructions: Pretending to be happy when you are not is a form of self-deception. It keeps you from facing your true feelings, your true experience, your true needs. Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, allow yourself to feel what you truly feel. Do not pretend. Do not hide. Do not deny. Be honest with yourself. Be present with your feelings. This is a practice in authenticity, in truth, in self-awareness.

steps.title: TODAY I WILL BE HONEST WITH MYSELF.
steps.instructions: Being honest with yourself is the foundation of all true learning, all true growth, all true relationship. Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, practice being honest with yourself. Look at your thoughts, your feelings, your actions. See them as they are, not as you wish them to be. Be present with your experience. Be truthful with yourself. This is a practice in self-honesty, in self-awareness, in self-acceptance.

steps.title: I WILL NOT LET DOUBT AND CONFUSION SLOW MY PROGRESS.
steps.instructions: Doubt and confusion are natural parts of the learning process, but they need not slow your progress. They are signs that you are encountering something new, something challenging, something that requires you to grow. Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, look at your doubts and confusions. See them for what they are. Do not let them stop you. Do not let them deter you. Move forward with the certainty of Knowledge within you.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: Today in your two long practice periods, review the past two weeks of your practice. Read each lesson slowly and carefully, and recall your practice and your experiences with each one. Allow each one to penetrate your mind. See their application in your life. See their relationship to one another. See how they are beginning to reveal a greater truth to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your own nature to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your purpose in the world. This review will take time, but it will be a great confirmation for you and it will give strength to your ability to learn and to prepare.

steps.title: I AM SENT HERE FOR A PURPOSE.
steps.instructions: You are sent here for a purpose, a purpose that you have not created but which you are designed to fulfill. This purpose is your contribution to the world, a contribution that can only be made through Knowledge. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, think about this idea. Think about what it means in your life. Think about how it is true for you. Think about how it has influenced your decisions and your behavior.

steps.title: I AM LOVED, AND I AM FREE TO LOVE.
steps.instructions: You are loved by the Creator, by the unseen forces that guide and protect you, and by Knowledge within you. You are free to love, to give, to contribute, to express the truth that lives within you. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel this love and this freedom. Feel the presence of love in your life. Feel the freedom to express it. This is a practice in feeling, in experiencing, in being present with the truth of your life.

steps.title: I AM A STUDENT OF KNOWLEDGE TODAY.
steps.instructions: Today you are a student of Knowledge. You are learning to listen, to feel, to see, to know. You are learning to be present, to be honest, to be open. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, affirm this idea. Feel yourself as a student of Knowledge. Feel the presence of your Teachers, who are with you always. Feel the presence of Knowledge within you, guiding you, teaching you, leading you.

steps.title: I WILL BE CONSISTENT TODAY.
steps.instructions: Consistency is the key to learning, to growth, to preparation. Without consistency, your efforts are scattered, your progress is slow, your mind is confused. Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, practice consistency. Be consistent in your practice. Be consistent in your focus. Be consistent in your intention. This is a practice in discipline, in commitment, in dedication.

steps.title: MY ERRORS GIVE BIRTH TO MY KNOWLEDGE.
steps.instructions: Your errors are not failures; they are opportunities to learn, to grow, to deepen your understanding. Your errors give birth to your Knowledge, for they show you what does not work, what is not true, what is not aligned with your purpose. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, look at your errors. Look at the mistakes you have made. See what they have taught you. See how they have led you to Knowledge.

steps.title: I HAVE A WISDOM THAT I WISH TO DISCOVER.
steps.instructions: Within you is a wisdom that you have brought with you from your Ancient Home. This wisdom is the wisdom of Knowledge, the wisdom of truth, the wisdom of purpose. Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, seek this wisdom. Feel its presence within you. Listen for its guidance. Be open to its direction. This is a practice in listening, in feeling, in being present with the deeper truth within you.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: Today in your two long practice periods, review the past two weeks of your practice. Read each lesson slowly and carefully, and recall your practice and your experiences with each one. Allow each one to penetrate your mind. See their application in your life. See their relationship to one another. See how they are beginning to reveal a greater truth to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your own nature to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your purpose in the world. This review will take time, but it will be a great confirmation for you and it will give strength to your ability to learn and to prepare.

steps.title: I WILL OBSERVE MYSELF TODAY TO LEARN OF KNOWLEDGE.
steps.instructions: Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, observe yourself. Observe your thoughts, your feelings, your actions. Observe how they align with Knowledge, how they express Knowledge, how they resist Knowledge. This is a practice in self-observation, in self-awareness, in learning to see yourself as you truly are.

steps.title: I WILL NOT USE FEAR TO SUPPORT MY BELIEFS.
steps.instructions: Fear is often used to support beliefs, to justify actions, to maintain illusions. But fear is not of Knowledge; it is of the mind, of separation, of illusion. Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, look at how you have used fear to support your beliefs. See how it has limited you, how it has confused you, how it has kept you from Knowledge. This is a practice in honesty, in clarity, in liberation.

steps.title: I HAVE THE POWER TO CHANGE MY LIFE.
steps.instructions: You have the power to change your life, for you have the power to follow Knowledge, to align with truth, to fulfill your purpose. This power is within you, waiting to be claimed, waiting to be expressed. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel this power. Feel its presence within you. Feel its potential in your life. This is a practice in empowerment, in confidence, in certainty.

steps.title: THE TRUTH IS WITH ME. I CAN FEEL IT.
steps.instructions: The truth is with you always, for the truth is Knowledge, and Knowledge is within you. You can feel it, if you are still, if you are present, if you are open. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel the truth within you. Feel the presence of Knowledge. Feel its certainty, its clarity, its strength. This is a practice in feeling, in experiencing, in being present with the truth.

steps.title: I HAVE A MISSION IN MY LIFE TO FULFILL.
steps.instructions: You have a mission in your life to fulfill, a mission that you have come to the world to accomplish. This mission is your purpose, your calling, your contribution. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, think about this idea. Think about what it means in your life. Think about how it is true for you. Think about how it has influenced your decisions and your behavior.

steps.title: I AM A BEGINNING STUDENT OF KNOWLEDGE.
steps.instructions: You are a beginning student of Knowledge, learning to listen, to feel, to see, to know. You are learning to be present, to be honest, to be open. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, affirm this idea. Feel yourself as a student of Knowledge. Feel the presence of your Teachers, who are with you always. Feel the presence of Knowledge within you, guiding you, teaching you, leading you.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: Today in your two long practice periods, review the past two weeks of your practice. Read each lesson slowly and carefully, and recall your practice and your experiences with each one. Allow each one to penetrate your mind. See their application in your life. See their relationship to one another. See how they are beginning to reveal a greater truth to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your own nature to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your purpose in the world. This review will take time, but it will be a great confirmation for you and it will give strength to your ability to learn and to prepare.

steps.title: MY LIFE IS A MYSTERY TO EXPLORE.
steps.instructions: Your life is a mystery to explore, a mystery that holds your purpose, your calling, your destiny. This mystery is not to be solved with the mind, but to be experienced with Knowledge. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, explore this mystery. Feel the mystery of your life. Be open to its depth, its wonder, its truth. This is a practice in exploration, in wonder, in openness.

steps.title: THERE IS A WAY TO KNOWLEDGE.
steps.instructions: There is a way to Knowledge, a way that you are learning, a way that you are following, a way that is being revealed to you. This way is the way of stillness, of listening, of honesty, of openness. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel this way. Feel the path to Knowledge within you. Feel its direction, its guidance, its certainty. This is a practice in following, in trusting, in being led.

steps.title: GOD HAS SPOKEN TO ME TODAY.
steps.instructions: God has spoken to you today through this lesson, through this practice, through this preparation. God speaks to you through Knowledge, through the truth within you, through the purpose you are here to fulfill. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel this communication. Feel the presence of God in your life. Feel the presence of Knowledge within you. This is a practice in receiving, in feeling, in being present with the divine.

steps.title: THE TRUTH IS WITH ME TODAY.
steps.instructions: The truth is with you today, as it is every day, for the truth is Knowledge, and Knowledge is within you. You can feel it, if you are still, if you are present, if you are open. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel the truth within you. Feel the presence of Knowledge. Feel its certainty, its clarity, its strength. This is a practice in feeling, in experiencing, in being present with the truth.

steps.title: TODAY I WILL FEEL THE TRUTH.
steps.instructions: Today you will feel the truth, the truth of Knowledge, the truth of your purpose, the truth of your presence in the world. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel this truth. Feel its presence within you. Feel its guidance, its direction, its certainty. This is a practice in feeling, in experiencing, in being present with the truth.

steps.title: I AM NOT AFRAID OF THE POWER OF GOD.
steps.instructions: The power of God is the power of Knowledge, the power of truth, the power of love. It is not something to fear, but something to embrace, something to receive, something to express. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel this power. Feel the power of God within you. Feel the power of Knowledge guiding you. This is a practice in courage, in trust, in openness to the divine.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: Today in your two long practice periods, review the past two weeks of your practice. Read each lesson slowly and carefully, and recall your practice and your experiences with each one. Allow each one to penetrate your mind. See their application in your life. See their relationship to one another. See how they are beginning to reveal a greater truth to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your own nature to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your purpose in the world. This review will take time, but it will be a great confirmation for you and it will give strength to your ability to learn and to prepare.

steps.title: MY MIND IS A VEHICLE FOR KNOWLEDGE.
steps.instructions: Your mind is a vehicle for Knowledge, a vehicle for truth, a vehicle for purpose. It is not meant to be a prison of fear, doubt, or confusion, but a tool for expression, for learning, for contribution. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel your mind as a vehicle for Knowledge. Feel its potential, its clarity, its strength. This is a practice in alignment, in clarity, in purpose.

steps.title: I AM HERE TO SERVE A GREATER PURPOSE.
steps.instructions: You are here to serve a greater purpose, a purpose that transcends your personal desires, your fears, your limitations. This purpose is your contribution to the world, a contribution that can only be made through Knowledge. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel this purpose. Feel its presence within you. Feel its direction, its guidance, its certainty. This is a practice in service, in purpose, in alignment.

steps.title: TODAY I WILL LISTEN TO THE POWER OF KNOWLEDGE.
steps.instructions: Today you will listen to the power of Knowledge, the power of truth, the power of purpose within you. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, listen for this power. Listen to your inner voice. Listen to the guidance of Knowledge. Be still, be present, be open. This is a practice in listening, in receiving, in being led.

steps.title: I WILL TRUST MY DEEPEST INCLINATIONS TODAY.
steps.instructions: Your deepest inclinations are the inclinations of Knowledge, the inclinations of truth, the inclinations of purpose. They are not the inclinations of fear, of doubt, of confusion. Today in your two practice periods, 15 minutes each, trust these inclinations. Feel them within you. Follow them in your practice. This is a practice in trust, in following, in being led by Knowledge.

steps.title: WHY DO I NEED TEACHERS?
steps.instructions: You need Teachers because you cannot learn alone. You need Teachers because you cannot see the way to Knowledge on your own. You need Teachers because they represent the presence of Knowledge, the presence of truth, the presence of guidance in your life. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, think about this idea. Think about why you need Teachers. Think about how they are helping you, guiding you, leading you to Knowledge.

steps.title: TRUE ASSISTANCE IS AVAILABLE TO ME.
steps.instructions: True assistance is available to you, through your Teachers, through Knowledge, through the unseen forces that guide and protect you. This assistance is always with you, always available, always ready to help. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel this assistance. Feel its presence in your life. Feel its guidance, its support, its love. This is a practice in receiving, in trusting, in being open to help.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: In your two long practice periods today, each of which should be at least 45 minutes, review the past two weeks of your practice. Read each lesson slowly and carefully, and recall your practice and your experiences with each one. Allow each one to penetrate your mind. See their application in your life. See their relationship to one another. See how they are beginning to reveal a greater truth to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your own nature to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your purpose in the world. This review will take time, but it will be a great confirmation for you and it will give strength to your ability to learn and to prepare.

steps.title: I WILL NOT LIVE IN THE PAST.
steps.instructions: Living in the past keeps you from being present, from being open, from being available to Knowledge. The past is gone; it cannot be changed. But the present is here, and it holds the promise of your future. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, let go of the past. Release your attachment to it. Be present with what is here now. This is a practice in letting go, in being present, in being free.

steps.title: I WILL NOT BE AFRAID OF MY MIND TODAY.
steps.instructions: Your mind is a powerful tool, but it can also be a source of fear, doubt, and confusion. Today, you will not be afraid of your mind. You will observe it, you will learn from it, but you will not let it control you. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, observe your mind. Watch its thoughts, its fears, its distractions. See them for what they are, but do not be afraid of them. This is a practice in observation, in detachment, in courage.

steps.title: I AM IN THE WORLD TO WORK.
steps.instructions: You are in the world to work, to contribute, to fulfill your purpose through action and service. This work is not merely your job or your duties; it is the work of Knowledge, the work of your true calling. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel this purpose to work. Feel the drive within you to contribute, to serve, to give. This is a practice in purpose, in action, in alignment with Knowledge.

steps.title: I WILL RECEIVE MY TEACHERS TODAY.
steps.instructions: Your Teachers are with you always, guiding you, supporting you, leading you to Knowledge. Today, you will receive them. You will feel their presence, their love, their guidance. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, open yourself to your Teachers. Feel their presence in your life. Be still, be receptive, be grateful. This is a practice in receiving, in gratitude, in connection.

steps.title: I WILL NOT LIVE IN IDEALISM.
steps.instructions: Idealism is a creation of the mind, a fantasy that keeps you from being present, from seeing the truth, from living in reality. Today, you will not live in idealism. You will see things as they are, not as you wish them to be. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, look at your ideals. See how they have limited you, how they have kept you from the truth. Let them go, and be present with what is real. This is a practice in clarity, in honesty, in reality.

steps.title: I WILL ACCEPT MY LIFE AS IT IS.
steps.instructions: Accepting your life as it is does not mean resignation; it means seeing the truth of your current state so that you can move forward with clarity and purpose. Today, you will accept your life as it is. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, look at your life. See it as it is, without judgment, without fantasy, without fear. Accept it, and feel the freedom that comes with this acceptance. This is a practice in acceptance, in clarity, in freedom.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: In your two long practice periods today, each of which should be at least 45 minutes, review the past two weeks of your practice. Read each lesson slowly and carefully, and recall your practice and your experiences with each one. Allow each one to penetrate your mind. See their application in your life. See their relationship to one another. See how they are beginning to reveal a greater truth to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your own nature to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your purpose in the world. This review will take time, but it will be a great confirmation for you and it will give strength to your ability to learn and to prepare.

steps.title: I WILL NOT BE CRUEL WITH MYSELF TODAY.
steps.instructions: Being cruel to yourself—through judgment, self-criticism, or denial—keeps you from Knowledge, from love, from truth. Today, you will not be cruel with yourself. You will be kind, you will be gentle, you will be honest. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice kindness toward yourself. Notice your judgments, your criticisms, and let them go. Be gentle with yourself as you learn and grow. This is a practice in kindness, in self-love, in honesty.

steps.title: I CAN ONLY PRACTICE.
steps.instructions: You cannot force Knowledge, you cannot demand it, you cannot control it. You can only practice, preparing yourself to receive it, to follow it, to express it. Today, you will focus on practice. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, engage in your practice with sincerity and dedication. Be present, be open, be willing. This is a practice in humility, in dedication, in preparation.

steps.title: TODAY I WILL LEARN PATIENCE.
steps.instructions: Patience is essential on the path to Knowledge, for true learning and growth take time. Today, you will learn patience. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice patience. Sit quietly, be still, and notice any impatience that arises. Let it go, and return to stillness. This is a practice in patience, in stillness, in trust.

steps.title: I WILL NOT JUDGE THE WORLD TODAY.
steps.instructions: Judging the world keeps you separate from it, keeps you from seeing its truth, its purpose, its reality. Today, you will not judge the world. You will observe it, you will experience it, but you will not judge it. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, look at the world around you. Notice your judgments, and let them go. Be present with the world as it is. This is a practice in observation, in neutrality, in openness.

steps.title: I WILL LISTEN TO THE WORLD TODAY.
steps.instructions: The world has a voice, a message, a truth to share with you, if you are willing to listen. Today, you will listen to the world. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, listen to the world around you. Hear its sounds, feel its presence, sense its movement. Be still, be open, be receptive. This is a practice in listening, in connection, in awareness.

steps.title: TODAY I WILL BE STRONG.
steps.instructions: Strength is not force; it is the quiet certainty of Knowledge, the resilience of truth, the power of purpose. Today, you will be strong. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel your strength. Feel the strength of Knowledge within you. Feel its certainty, its clarity, its power. This is a practice in strength, in certainty, in alignment.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: In your two long practice periods today, each of which should be at least 45 minutes, review the past two weeks of your practice. Read each lesson slowly and carefully, and recall your practice and your experiences with each one. Allow each one to penetrate your mind. See their application in your life. See their relationship to one another. See how they are beginning to reveal a greater truth to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your own nature to you. This is a practice in listening, in connection, in awareness.

steps.title: TODAY I WILL LISTEN TO OTHERS.
steps.instructions: Listening to others allows you to hear their truth, to connect with them, to learn from them. Today, you will listen to others. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, think of the people in your life. Imagine listening to them deeply, hearing their words, feeling their presence. Be open, be receptive, be present. This is a practice in listening, in connection, in relationship.

steps.title: TODAY I WILL BE PATIENT.
steps.instructions: Patience is essential on the path to Knowledge, for true learning and growth take time. Today, you will be patient. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice patience. Sit quietly, be still, and notice any impatience that arises. Let it go, and return to stillness. This is a practice in patience, in stillness, in trust.

steps.title: TODAY I WILL BE OBSERVANT.
steps.instructions: Being observant allows you to see the truth, to learn from your experiences, to be present with Knowledge. Today, you will be observant. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice observation. Look at your thoughts, your feelings, your surroundings. Observe without judgment, without reaction, just see. This is a practice in observation, in presence, in awareness.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: In your two long practice periods today, each of which should be at least 45 minutes, review the past two weeks of your practice. Read each lesson slowly and carefully, and recall your practice and your experiences with each one. Allow each one to penetrate your mind. See their application in your life. See their relationship to one another. See how they are beginning to reveal a greater truth to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your own nature to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your purpose in the world. This review will take time, but it will be a great confirmation for you and it will give strength to your ability to learn and to prepare.

steps.title: I WILL NOT JUDGE MYSELF TODAY.
steps.instructions: Judging yourself keeps you from Knowledge, from self-acceptance, from growth. Today, you will not judge yourself. Let them go, and be present with yourself as you are. This is a practice in self-acceptance, in neutrality, in growth.

In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice stillness. Sit quietly, close your eyes, and be still. Let go of thoughts, let go of distractions, and be present. This is a practice in stillness, in presence, in connection.

steps.title: I WILL BE STRONG TODAY.
steps.instructions: Strength is not force; it is the quiet certainty of Knowledge, the resilience of truth, the power of purpose. Today, you will be strong. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel your strength. Feel the strength of Knowledge within you. Feel its certainty, its clarity, its power. This is a practice in strength, in certainty, in alignment.

steps.title: REVIEW
steps.instructions: In your two long practice periods today, each of which should be at least 45 minutes, review the past two weeks of your practice. Read each lesson slowly and carefully, and recall your practice and your experiences with each one. Allow each one to penetrate your mind. See their application in your life. See their relationship to one another. See how they are beginning to reveal a greater truth to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your own nature to you. See how they are beginning to reveal your purpose in the world. This review will take time, but it will be a great confirmation for you and it will give strength to your ability to learn and to prepare.

steps.title: I WILL BE CONSISTENT TODAY.
steps.instructions: Consistency is the key to learning, to growth, to preparation. Without consistency, your efforts are scattered, your progress is slow, your mind is confused. Today, you will be consistent. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice consistency. Be consistent in your practice, in your focus, in your intention. This is a practice in discipline, in commitment, in dedication.

steps.title: I WILL BE WITH KNOWLEDGE TODAY.
steps.instructions: Being with Knowledge means being present, being open, being aligned with the truth within you. Today, you will be with Knowledge. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel the presence of Knowledge within you. Be still, be open, be receptive. Let Knowledge guide you, let Knowledge be with you. This is a practice in presence, in connection, in alignment.

steps.title: I AM WITH KNOWLEDGE TODAY.
steps.instructions: You are with Knowledge, present, open, and aligned with the truth within you. Today, you will affirm this connection. Upon the hour, repeat this statement to yourself and feel its truth: 'I am with Knowledge today.' In your two deeper practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel the presence of Knowledge within you. Be still, be open, be receptive. Let Knowledge guide you, let Knowledge be with you. This is a practice in presence, in connection, in alignment.

steps.instructions: Stillness is the gateway to Knowledge, the space where you can hear, feel, and know the truth within you. Today, you will be still. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice stillness. Sit quietly, close your eyes, and be still. Let go of thoughts, let go of distractions, and be present. This is a practice in stillness, in presence, in connection.

steps.instructions: Strength is not force; it is the quiet certainty of Knowledge, the resilience of truth, the power of purpose. Today, you will be strong. steps.title: I WILL BE PATIENT TODAY.
steps.instructions: Patience is essential on the path to Knowledge, for true learning and growth take time. Today, you will be patient. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice patience. Sit quietly, be still, and notice any impatience that arises. Let it go, and return to stillness. This is a practice in patience, in stillness, in trust.

steps.title: I WILL BE PRESENT TODAY.
steps.instructions: Being present allows you to be with Knowledge, to be with truth, to be with your purpose in each moment. Today, you will be present. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice presence. Be here now, let go of the past, let go of the future, and be fully in this moment. This is a practice in presence, in awareness, in being.

steps.title: I WILL BE OBSERVANT TODAY.
steps.instructions: Being observant allows you to see the truth, to learn from your experiences, to be present with Knowledge. Today, you will be observant. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice observation. Look at your thoughts, your feelings, your surroundings. Observe without judgment, without reaction, just see. This is a practice in observation, in presence, in awareness.

steps.title: I WILL NOT JUDGE TODAY.
steps.instructions: Judgment separates you from Knowledge, from others, from the world, keeping you in conflict and confusion. Today, you will not judge. You will observe, you will be present, but you will not judge. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, notice any judgments that arise—about yourself, others, or the world. Let them go, and return to a state of observation and presence. This is a practice in neutrality, in openness, in peace.

steps.title: I WILL BE GRATEFUL TODAY.
steps.instructions: Gratitude opens your heart to Knowledge, to love, to the truth of your life. Today, you will be grateful. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, feel gratitude. Feel gratitude for your life, for your Teachers, for Knowledge, for the opportunity to learn and grow. This is a practice in gratitude, in openness, in connection.

steps.title: I WILL LISTEN TODAY.
steps.instructions: Listening allows you to hear Knowledge, to connect with others, to be present with the world. Today, you will listen. In your two practice periods today, 15 minutes each, practice listening. Listen to your inner voice, listen to others, listen to the world around you. Be still, be open, be receptive. This is a practice in listening, in connection, in awareness.
